channel.title: What's the benefit of overclocking?
channel.description: I see a lot of people posting about overclocking.. I know what it is, but I don't know the benefits of it. I have an Intel Core i7 Quad Core running at 2.4GHz, it's overclockable safetly to 3.5GHz .. Is it worth it?

item.title: What's the benefit of overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

If you never max out your cpu there’s no point in over clocking, no point risking your hardware on a few more Ghz’s

Read full topic

item.title: What's the benefit of overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:4, topic:545765”][quote author=rmark45matsu link=topic=664648.msg4443076#msg4443076 date=1407527093]
You get a faster computer, and more performance. If you have a stock cooler that came with the computer, that probably won’t do for overclocking you may have to invest in a more powerful one to keep your temps low.
[/quote]
An i7 running at 2.4 is most likely a mobile processor, and that is a lot harder to take care of.

@OP: Your i7 already has Intel Turbo Boost so it will overclock itself when needed without the risk of running too hot 24/7. If this is indeed a laptop you’ll want to be very careful.[/quote]

Yeah, it’s a gaming notebook. I mean, it’s 12GB RAM, and Quad core i7 at 2.4GHz and it’s plenty fast for my needs as is. So is there not even a point in overclocking?

Read full topic

item.title: What's the benefit of overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

The intel i7 may is at 2.4, but when its needed it will automaticly go to up to 3.4, I know this because I have the exact same processor.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the benefit of overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

rmark45matsu:

You get a faster computer, and more performance. If you have a stock cooler that came with the computer, that probably won’t do for overclocking you may have to invest in a more powerful one to keep your temps low.

An i7 running at 2.4 is most likely a mobile processor, and that is a lot harder to take care of.

@OP: Your i7 already has Intel Turbo Boost so it will overclock itself when needed without the risk of running too hot 24/7. If this is indeed a laptop you’ll want to be very careful.

Read full topic

item.title: What's the benefit of overclocking?

@rmark45matsu wrote:

You get a faster computer, and more performance. If you have a stock cooler that came with the computer, that probably won’t do for overclocking you may have to invest in a more powerful one to keep your temps low.
